question: A train 200 m long running at 36 km/hr takes 55 seconds to cross a bridge. The length of the bridge is :
explanation:
Speed of train = 36 km/hr
$latex = 36\\times \\frac{5}{18} = 10\\ m/sec.&s=1$
If the length of the bridge be x metre, then
$latex 10 = \\frac{200+x}{55}&s=1$
$latex => 200+x = 550$
$latex => x = 550-200 = 350\\ metre$
Hence option [C] is correct answer.
